arts.ttl: Sunderland bucking the trend, but how bad is it for Wolves?
arts.sum: Sunderland have made their joint-best start to a Premier League season following victory at the Stadium of Light, but can Wolves stop the rot?

arts.ttl: Sunderland condemn Wolves to another defeat
arts.sum: A first Sunderland goal for Nordi Mukiele and an own goal from Ladislav Krejci's condemn Wolves to a sixth defeat from eight matches.

arts.ttl: Regis Le Bris hails team character as Sunderland claim ‚Äòtough win‚Äô over Wolves
arts.sum: Nordi Mukiele‚Äôs strike and a Ladislav Krejci own goal made sure of the points.

arts.ttl: Le Bris praises Mukiele's energy as Sunderland beat Wolves
arts.sum: Sunderland manager Regis Le Bris is pleased with his sides performance, especially Mukiele's providing "brilliant" energy and commitment going forward, scoring early on for Sunderland, resulting in a 2-0 win against Wolves at the Stadium of Light.

The visitors had a chance at the start of the second half as they worked the ball down the left and Hugo Bueno swung in a cross, Munetsi chested it down for Joao Gomes, but he lashed it wide inside the box. Wolves improved marginally as the half progressed and had some good set piece opportunities, while one dangerous Munetsi cross caught the eye, but they were still lacking the final ball.

arts.ttl: Nordi Mukiele on target as Sunderland sink Wolves to continue strong start
arts.athr: Louise Taylor at the Stadium of Light
arts.sum: R√©gis Le Bris looked concerned. ‚ÄúWe can feel the danger,‚Äù said Sunderland‚Äôs manager last week as he suggested that a Wolves renaissance could be just round the corner. If so, that old gold revival suffered a damaging delay on an an afternoon when Le Bris‚Äôs fears proved groundless as Sunderland registered their fourth Premier League win in eight games since promotion. It leaves them with 14 points and surely set fair for survival. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Sunderland's impressive PL start continues as Wolves remain winless
arts.sum: Sunderland‚Äôs impressive start to life back in the Premier League continued as the Wearsiders beat winless Wolves 2-0 at the Stadium of Light.
